messages: b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:06): the SVG people weren't very clever with their tag naming
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:06): "malignmark" sounds evil; why would I want that in my graphics?
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (22:07): does sound like a hex doesn't it? ;)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:21): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f: How is your parser coming along? Is it close to usable yet?
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:21): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: I'm one test away from passing the html5lib tests
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:22): so, probably fairly usable :)
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:23): I'm currently fighting with scoping and the commented-out bits in the spec that deal with SVG
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:26): I will have to take a look
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:26): should find some time to work on html5lib as well
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:27): I quite fancy doing some work on html5lib to learn python
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:27): since I know html5-parsing fairly well know
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:48): actually, the C html parser I've been working on is now passing all tests
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:48): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f: Nice. Now if only I could get it to find libiconv :(
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:52): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: what OS are you using?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:52): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f: Although I could probably find a linux box if that is likely to be easier
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:52): s/find/log on to/
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:53): linux would be much easier, I think
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:53): fefe4c60d912e295e59fd874577ca7f9 (the other developer) has OS X, but I don't know what hoops he jumps through to compile
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:54): I think tomorrow I'll take a break from coding and write up API docs
fefe4c60d912e295e59fd874577ca7f9 (22:56): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: depends where the problem is. if it's the test harnesses, then add -liconv to the LDFLAGS in test/Makefile
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:58): fefe4c60d912e295e59fd874577ca7f9: Thanks, that helped a bit (I had added it in the wrong place apparently) now I get a different error :)
fefe4c60d912e295e59fd874577ca7f9 (22:59): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: feel free to pastebin it or somesuch :)

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:01): fefe4c60d912e295e59fd874577ca7f9: http://pastebin.ca/1069420 (maybe I have an old version of the source? I used the "download tarball" link on the repo browser)

fefe4c60d912e295e59fd874577ca7f9 (23:02): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: there's a couple of patches we need to feed upstream (e.g. handling of \0 in input)
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (23:04): fefe4c60d912e295e59fd874577ca7f9: have you emailed the fella about that?  if not, might be worth setting up a google code project for it or something
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:04): fefe4c60d912e295e59fd874577ca7f9: I put json-c 0.7 in json/json-c-0.7/ (and installed it) do I need to do something else, like change the directory names?
fefe4c60d912e295e59fd874577ca7f9 (23:04): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f: no, I haven't. two reasons: a) laziness b) lack of response to the last set of patches I sent

b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (23:06): actually, don't, that's just for one file

fefe4c60d912e295e59fd874577ca7f9 (23:06): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: the readme in hubbub/json is out of date. I need to fix that. please accept my apologies. if you build the version at svn://source.netsurf-browser.org/trunk/json-c/json-c, then you should have the stuff it needs
fefe4c60d912e295e59fd874577ca7f9 (23:07): s/build/build and install/
